overview: From 2025-06-15 to 2025-06-22, elizaos/eliza had 36 new PRs (26 merged), 5 new issues, and 23 active contributors.

topIssues.title: /api/agents/{agentId}/rooms -> API endpoint not found
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to call the /rooms endpoint on my existing agent and getting a 404:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57206b48-f124-4937-98ba-5914f9e6ca59)

Here you can see that this particular agent exists:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53b4ace7-4801-497a-ace1-f8dee3569d6d)

I am on version 1.0.9

**To Reproduce**

Create agent, try to GET or POST /rooms on the agendId endpoint

**Expected behavior**

I was expecting to retrieve the rooms of the agent

**Screenshots**

(see above)

** Additional Context **

Both /logs and /memories on this particular agentId are working. Just /rooms returns the 404 "API endpoint not found" on both POST and GET
`http://localhost:3000/api/agents/b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2/rooms`

topIssues.title: Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to get rag working and following docs, but that code is not implemented in 1.0.6.  It appears to be commented as a placeholder in 
 
**To Reproduce**

settings: {
    secrets: {},
    ragKnowledge: true,
  },
  knowledge: [
    {
      directory: 'knowledge/foobar',
      shared: true,
    },
  ],

**Expected behavior**

I expect that it would parse on startup and it was not doing that, as it used to do.  So, I looked into code and found this... summary from claude....

Missing Implementation Locations

  1. AgentRuntime Initialization Missing Knowledge 
  Processing

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 494-651)
  - The AgentRuntime.initialize() method should process
  character.knowledge but doesn't
  - No call to any knowledge processing function during
  agent startup

  2. TODO Comment Confirms Missing Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/specs/v1/index.ts (line 50)
  // TODO: Implement the remaining adapters: ... - 
  knowledge / memory
  This is a developer comment explicitly stating that
  knowledge processing is not implemented yet.

  3. Bootstrap Plugin Missing KNOWLEDGE Provider

  File: /packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts
  - Multiple message examples reference providers: 
  ['KNOWLEDGE'] in character files
  - But the bootstrap plugin doesn't export any KNOWLEDGE 
  provider
  - Provider list is incomplete - missing the knowledge
  provider entirely

  4. RagService Interface Exists But No Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 52-61)
  interface RagServiceDelegator extends Service {
    getKnowledge(message: Memory, scope?: { roomId?: UUID;
   worldId?: UUID; entityId?: UUID }):
  Promise<KnowledgeItem[]>;
    _internalAddKnowledge(item: KnowledgeItem, options?:
  any, scope?: any): Promise<void>;
  }
  The interface exists but no actual implementation of
  this service.

  5. Missing Functions

  - processCharacterKnowledge() - Referenced in docs but
  doesn't exist anywhere
  - No knowledge file reading/processing logic
  - No connection between character.knowledge array and
  embedding system

  Developer Comments Confirming This

  The codebase has explicit TODO comments indicating that
  knowledge/memory functionality is intentionally 
  unfinished. The character examples even reference
   a KNOWLEDGE provider that doesn't exist, suggesting
  this was planned but never implemented.

topIssues.title: @elizaos/cli test command incorrectly requires monorepo root for standalone projects
topIssues.author: sicco-moonbeam
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

The elizaos test command incorrectly assumes that E2E tests must be run from within the ElizaOS monorepo structure, even when running tests for standalone projects created with `elizaos create`. This prevents running E2E tests in standalone projects that are meant to extend ElizaOS functionality.


**To Reproduce**

1. Create a new ElizaOS project
```elizaos create my-project```

2. Run the e2e tests:

```npm run test:e2e```

3. Error: Could not find monorepo root. Make sure to run tests from within the Eliza project.

**Expected behavior**

The elizaos test command should:
1. Recognize standalone projects created with elizaos create
2. Run E2E tests in the project's e2e/ directory
3. Not require the full ElizaOS monorepo structure

**Screenshots**

N/A

**Additional context**

- Error is reliably reproducible with any "out-of-the-box" project created with @elizaos/cli

topIssues.title: Plugin list in GUI settings displays duplicates
topIssues.author: tcm390

topPRs.title: feat: Split server package from CLI (continued shaw's PR)
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Split server functionality into separate `@elizaos/server` package
- Maintains full backward compatibility with existing CLI integrations
- Enables independent usage of server components
- Updated all CLI imports to use the new server package

## Test plan
- [x] All existing CLI tests pass
- [x] Server package builds and exports correctly
- [x] Backward compatibility maintained
- [x] Integration tests verify CLI + server work together
- [x] Type safety preserved across package boundaries

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: Add server, add tests
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds detailed tests to core, server, project-starter and plugin-starter

Project-starter and plugin-starter have had frontends added with cypress testing, to make frontend development easier and more clear

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Made significant documentation improvements with three open PRs (#5131, #5133, #5134) focused on accuracy, consistency, and descriptive comments, while also fixing CLI test failures through PR #5135 (+16/-2 lines). Contributed substantial code changes across 384 files (+69402/-3388 lines) in 30 commits, with primary focus on bugfixes (40%) and feature work (30%). Opened issue #5124 for Eliza Postman JSON updates and participated in discussions with 4 issue comments and 2 PR comments, while also providing 1 approval review.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged two PRs this week, including a bug fix for agent thinking status (#5128, +16/-1 lines) and a significant type improvement PR (#5126, +1432/-1000 lines) that enforced strict CLI typing. Contributed a total of +1448/-1001 lines across 77 files while also approving 2 code reviews.

lalalune: Made a substantial code contribution by merging PR #5125 "Add server, add tests" which modified 224 files with +63,093/-3,694 lines of code. This significant feature work was completed in a single day, representing a major addition to the codebase with primarily new code being added rather than modifications to existing code.

monilpat: Currently working on the Quickswap plugin with two open PRs: a draft implementation (#5123) and a PR to fix compiler errors in the plugin tests (#5132). No merged contributions or other activity this period.

maximevtush: Fixed a typo in the Unfollow Room Action and a variable name in a plugin-related file through PR #5130 (+3/-3 lines). This was their only contribution during the week, with activity on just one day.

zeevick10: Made a small documentation improvement by fixing typos in the Plugin Documentation for Flow and MultiversX through PR #5127 (+2/-2 lines). This was their only contribution during the period, focusing entirely on documentation maintenance.
michavie: Fixed a bug in bootstrap evaluator callbacks with PR #5129, removing 9 lines and adding 1 line of code.
github-advanced-security: Provided 2 review comments this week with no other activity. Their contribution was minimal during this period with no code changes, PRs, or issue activity.
